chargeHist.descr: Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle

result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley A Hayek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Death, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 25 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: It is the courts intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all  money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim's family (person, property, residence).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

01:56 PM Defendant Bradley A Hayek in court, in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950, decedents family members are in court. Based on deft's request that appellate atty withdraw, SPD will not reappoint. Deft now indicates he wishes to have an atty but hasn't done anything to retain counsel.
